column1: A board was floating along on the swollen waters of Black Creek. On it sat Master Meadow Mouse. He was very happy. He was having his first ride
column2: of any sort."This raft—" he said to himself proudly—"this raft belongs to me. I'll be a traveler. I'll see the world—at least as far as the big willow at the lower end of the meadow!"He scarcely cared to go beyond the big willow. Beyond it lay another farm. And Master Meadow Mouse had never been off Farmer Green's place in his whole life. He feared that he might not be able to find his way back
column3: if he ventured too far from home.Soon he spied a friend on the bank of the creek. Master Meadow Mouse cried
column4: "Goodbye!" and waved a paw at him.The person on the bank was one of his many cousins. And when he caught sight of Master Meadow Mouse he stared hard for a few moments. Then he shouted
column5: "Don't jump! I'll rescue you." He was already running to the water's edge when Master Meadow Mouse stopped him.
